description.en: Firstly, we reflect on the nature and role of international humanitarian law, and its relation to other branches of international law. We study the fundamental principles of international humanitarian law, and learn what is an armed conflict, which is a prerequisite for the application of international humanitarian law. We examine the status of persons in armed conflict because it determines their rights, duties and protection. We explore numerous rules on choosing the means and methods of warfare, and on planning and executing military operations. We come to a bloc that is dedicated to the treatment of different groups of persons (civilians, wounded, sick and shipwrecked, and prisoners of war and other captured persons). We assess what happens when the territory falls under belligerent occupation. Finally, we look at the ways to implement and to ensure respect for international humanitarian law.
description.et: Alustuseks selgitatakse rahvusvahelise humanitaarõiguse olemust ja rolli ning selle suhet teiste rahvusvahelise õiguse harudega. Uuritakse rahvusvahelise humanitaarõiguse fundamentaalseid põhimõtteid ja avatakse relvakonflikti mõiste, mis on rahvusvahelise humanitaarõiguse rakendamise eelduseks. Hinnatakse isikute staatust relvakonfliktis, sest sellest sõltuvad nende õigused, kohustused ja kaitse. Käsitletakse arvukaid reegleid, mis puudutavad sõjapidamise viiside ja vahendite valimist ning sõjaliste operatsioonide planeerimist ja läbiviimist. Seejärel jõutakse blokini, kus uuritakse erinevate isikute gruppide kohtlemist (tsiviilisikud, haavatud, haiged ja merehädalised ning sõjavangid ja teised kinnipeetud isikud). Lõpetuseks puudutatakse humanitaarõiguse rakendamise ja tagamise võimalusi.

objectives.en: To provide comprehensive understanding of the legal regulation applicable in armed conflicts
objectives.et: Anda mitmekülgne arusaam relvakonfliktides kehtivast õiguslikust regulatsioonist

learning_outcomes.en: The student who has completed the course is able to:
— Understand the nature and role of humanitarian law
— Distinguish between different types of armed conflicts
— Choose lawful methods and means of warfare depending on the situation
learning_outcomes.et: — Valib õiguspärased sõjapidamise viisid ja vahendid vastavalt olukorrale

learning_outcomes.en: — Explain the regulation of the treatment of civilians, wounded, sick and shipwrecked, and prisoners of war and other captured persons
learning_outcomes.et: — Selgitab tsiviilisikute, haavatute, haigete ja merehädaliste ning sõjavangide ja teiste kinnipeetud isikute kohtlemise regulatsiooni

learning_outcomes.en: — Identify the mechanisms to implement and to ensure respect for humanitarian law
learning_outcomes.et: — Toob välja humanitaarõiguse rakendamise ja tagamise mehhanisme

learning_outcomes.en: — Assess real-life situation and to solve hypothetical cases in a manner which is based on sound interpretation and application of humanitarian law
learning_outcomes.et: — Hindab päriselulisi situatsioone ja lahendab hüpoteetilisi kaasusi viisil, mis põhineb humanitaarõiguse adekvaatselt tõlgendamisel ja rakendamisel

independent_work.en:
— Write a research paper where the student analyses critically select legal problems related to international humanitarian law.
— The selected topic must be registered via Moodle (using the messaging function) no later than on 21 April. The instructor may ask the student to choose another topic if the chosen topic is not suitable or someone has already chosen the same problem. The paper must be submitted electronically as a Word-file no later than on 12 May at 1200 (noon) via Moodle. For every started overdue day, the result will be decreased by three points, but papers which are late more than four days are not accepted and the student may not take the exam. The instructor does not consider papers sent by email.
— The paper must include title page, table of content, main body and list of used materials. For references, use footnotes. The length of main text (starting from the introduction and ending with the conclusion, excluding footnotes) should be 2500-3000 words. Shorter papers are not accepted or the result is lowered by the discretion of the instructor.
— Independent identification of clear issues and legal problems is very important. Also, the use of different sources and supportive materials. All used sources must be referred to. In case of internet sources, the full address is necessary, not only the main domain (for example, www.un.org). A paper based on copy-paste method leads to negative results for both the paper and the exam. Plagiarism is not tolerated at the University of Tartu.

grade_evaluation.en:
— Seminar assignment (20 points)
— Research paper (40 points)
— Written exam (40 points)

A.en: Answers to theoretical questions are remarkable; the examination of hypothetical cases is full, logical and creative; the analysis of legal problems is detailed and innovative; all relevant norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice are thoughtful and creative; the form is excellent; overall, the text is a remarkable achievement (91-100 points)

B.en: Answers to theoretical questions are very good with insignificant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is purposeful and creative; the analysis of legal problems is very good with insignificant deficiencies; necessary norms and principles have been used; the references to state and court practice support the conclusions; the form is very good; overall, the treatment of the subject is logical and smooth (81-90 points)

C.en: Answers to theoretical questions are good, but there are mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases addresses correctly the central issues; the analysis of legal problems is good with some deficiencies concerning specific issues; key norms and principles have been used; the form is good; overall, the coverage of the subject is logical, but there are some weaknesses from the point of view of the whole (71-80 points)

D.en: Answers to theoretical questions are fair, but there are several mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is satisfactory, but focuses only on the central aspects; the analysis of legal problems is satisfactory with deficiencies is most aspects; only basic norms and principles have been used; the form is fair; overall, the treatment of the subject is plausible, but insecure (61-70 points)

E.en: Answers to theoretical questions are poor with significant mistakes or omissions; the examination of hypothetical cases is weak and limited only to the very basic aspects; the analysis of legal problems is shallow with significant deficiencies is most aspects; only some rudimentary norms and principles have been used; overall, the coverage of the subject suffers of superficial treatment, poor knowledge of law and unsound presentation (51-60 points)
